captions.text: [APPLAUSE]
>>HEY EVERYBODY,
HOW ARE YOU DOING TONIGHT?
[CHEERING]
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR BEING HERE.
WE HAVE A FANTASTIC EPISODE IN THE WORKS FOR TONIGHT.
THE ENTIRE CAST IS BACKSTAGE GETTING EVERYTHING READY
FOR THIS HISTORIC EVENT, OUR 49TH EPISODE!
[CHEERING]
AS YOU ALL KNOW, 49 EPISODES IS A HUGE
LANDMARK FOR A TV SHOW.
IT'S HALFWAY TO THAT MAGICAL 98TH EPISODE.
AND 49 IS JUST A GREAT NUMBER IN GENERAL.
>>49. IT'S THE LAST YEAR BEFORE YOU'RE OLD.
>>49 IS A PRIME NUMBER; IF YOU'RE BAD AT MATH.
>>49 IS THE CLOSEST NUMERICAL RHYME TO PORCUPINE.
>>AND ACTUALLY 49 IS STILL PRETTY OLD.
>>49 PERCENT IS AN F.
>>THE 49TH STATE WAS ALASKA, A PLACE SO GREAT,
THEY PAY YOU TO LIVE THERE!
>>AND 49 IS REALLY SPECIAL TO ME.
>>STEVE YOUNG, YOUR NUMBER WAS 8.
>>YEAH, BUT I PLAYED FOR-- >>SAN FRANCISCO,
I KNOW.
WHAT?
>>EPISODE 49 IS A TIME FOR LOOKING BACK.
HOW MANY OF YOU REMEMBER THIS CLASSIC MOMENT
FROM EPISODE 48?
ROLL IT.
>>RIGHT.
>>NOT TO MENTION, THE CAST OF A SKETCH
COMEDY SHOW CHANGES A LOT OVER 49 EPISODES.
CHECK OUT THAT FRAME!
CRAZY!
>>SO ENJOY THIS SPECIAL EPISODE.
>>WAIT, WE'RE DOING SOMETHING SPECIAL IN THIS EPISODE?
>>NO. NOW ENJOY THESE 49 PIECES OF CONFETTI.
THANKS FOR WATCHING THE "INTRO" TO OUR 49TH EPISODE.
AND NOW, SUBSCRIBE AND TELL 49 OF YOUR FRIENDS TO SUBSCRIBE TO.
THAT'S NOT THAT MUCH
I BET YOU HAVE 49 FRIENDS ON INSTAGRAM
WHOSE NAME START WITH THE LETTER "Q"
QUENTIN, QUILLEN, QUEEN ELIZABETH.
YOU KNOW, I KNOW YOU GOT THEM 'KAY, SO JUST
[CLAP] [CLAP] SUBSRIBE.

title: Studio C's 49th Episode Intro - Studio C

comments.text:
Your joke about the cast member "change" helped me get over not being a 
member of the cast.  I've always wanted to joke it up with you guys, even 
for a moment.  It would literally make my day if I got to meet just one of 
you guys and laugh it up.

I'll catch you guys when I move to Utah...maybe.﻿

comments.author: Kara Howard

comments.text:
We, who live in the 49th state, when we refer to the rest of the country 
say "the lower 48" and when we leave Alaska we say we are going "outside." 
We are the only state that can boast we are the furthest west and the 
furthest east. Santa Claus lives in North Pole, Alaska. Here, we do 
everything in a big way, I am a survivor of the largest earthquake ever 
recorded in North America, a quake measuring 9.2 and lasting close to five 
minutes. And to top it all off, we get paid to live here!﻿
